definition: to dissipate the effects of alcohol
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: Bending knees and bouncing in the modern dance hangover stretch increases the warm-up.
sentences.chinese: 弯曲的膝盖和在现代舞蹈解酒伸展弹跳增加热身。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE To observe the effects of the Jiejiule for anti-inebriation.
sentences.chinese: 观察解酒乐的解酒效果。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE To observe the effects of the Jiejiule for anti-inebriation.
sentences.chinese: 观察解酒乐的解酒效果。

sentences.english: To improve the brix to acid ratio in VECO will not decrease its effects on soberness.
sentences.chinese: 而且提高金葛露糖酸比值不会影响其解酒效果。

sentences.english: Conclusion: Gegen Mixture could alleviate the alcohol intoxication.
sentences.chinese: 结论复方葛根合剂具有解酒作用。

sentences.english: The soberness effects of VECO and its formula components were studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究金葛露及其配方物质在解酒方面的作用效果。

sentences.english: We are clear that drugs are not really anti-alcohol hangover.
sentences.chinese: 我们很清楚解酒药并不能真正地解酒。

sentences.english: CONCLUSION The Jiejiule has effects for anti-inebriation.
CONCLUSION The Jiejiule has effects for anti-inebriation.
Flos Pueraria omeiensis & Ilex latifolia(PL) decoction is often used for antialcoholism and treatment of hepatitis.
sentences.chinese: “野葛花枸骨叶汤”常被用来解酒毒和治疗肝炎。

sentences.english: Sir John, but our way is, to take a hair of the same dog next morning.
sentences.chinese: 约翰爵士，我们的办法却是第二天早上喝点酒来解酒。

sentences.english: Egyptians tend to wash down these libations with black tea.
sentences.chinese: 埃及人习惯用红茶解酒。

sentences.english: This result indicated that certain amount of olive juice was effective on anti-alcohol and liver- protection.
sentences.chinese: 试验结果提示一定剂量的橄榄汁具有解酒护肝作用。

definition: to dissipate the effects of alcohol/to sober up
to detoxify/to relieve fever (in Chinese medicine)
to nourish one's skin/to maintain a youthful appearance
to warm oneself/to expel the cold (TCM)
to moisten the lungs/to make expectoration easy (medicine)
to alleviate fever (medicine)/to clear internal heat (Chinese medicine)
